abstract: Federal appeals court decision upholding 2014 Louisiana law requiring abortion doctors to secure admitting privileges at nearby hospitals leads to closure of one of state's four abortion clinics and leaves three others with no doctors to perform abortions; five of six abortion doctors in state applied for privileges at hospitals in wake of passage of law, only to be rejected.

headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Upholds Law Restricting Louisiana Abortion Doctors
headline.main: Appeals Court Upholds Law Restricting Louisiana Abortion Doctors

snippet: The Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals voted to allow a 2014 state law requiring abortion doctors to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals go into effect, reducing the number of remaining clinics to two.
lead_paragraph: The Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals voted to allow a 2014 state law requiring abortion doctors to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals go into effect, reducing the number of remaining clinics to two.
